Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the interior bears traces of a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a lightly burnished red-brown self-slip and remains of two lines of Greek text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: Being studied for publication by Bryan Kraemer. Cemeteries and Osireion Excavations Group
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393799) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393799)
